intro: Campyloneurum chlorolepis, commonly known as the green-veined moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and bright green leaves with prominent midribs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as gametangia, are borne on specialized stalks called paraphyses. Campyloneurum chlorolepis plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
